ygData.subject: Re: Back to the Ark
ygData.msgSnippet: Rat Trap could not let go of the fact that Rodimus may not have turned sides on purpose.  Yet he speaks no more of him around Lord Elder.  Tucson senses it in

Rat Trap could not let go of the fact that Rodimus may not have turned side=
s on purpose.  Yet he speaks no more of him around Lord Elder.  Tucson sens=
es it in Rat Trap's quiet grunt.  Lord Elder made sense to him.  Right now,=
 he did not need to bad mouth Rodimus for what happened to him, he had to t=
ry to UNDERSTAND what happened and try to figure out a way to help him and =
try to put the past behind him once he did  help him. 

"Rat Trap, I don't =
want to sound like a demon's advocate here, but, Lord Elder is right.  I do=
n't think Rodimus really intended to turn sides like he did, and perhaps th=
e force that got him there was far greater than he could fend off.  We real=
ly shouldn't jump to conclusions."

Quickstride listens in as well.

" Good=
 point.  We really should listen ta Tucson, Rat Trap, and Lord Elder."

Rat=
 Trap sighs.

"Okay, I promise not one more bad word outa my mouth about an=
yone.. Except for the Preds and Decepticons.  Now about that minion...  I a=
lmost forgot about that one Lord Elder..  Gee, bad me, forgot ta put my toy=
s away when I was done playn' with 'em.."

Tucson struggles to get on his f=
eet, and walks over to Lord Elder.

" I've got an idea Lord Elder...  It wo=
rked at that Fortress, so it might work here..  My sonar transmitter.. If w=
e can augment the frequency from my transmitter through the audio systems o=
f this ship, we may just be able to stun that minion and any others that ar=
e around the Maximal base.  Of course, being careful to program the frequen=
cy so it doesn't harm Maximals or Autobots... Let's see...  I've done somet=
hing to that effect before...  I'll do a very mild form of the sonar transm=
ission, and let me know if any of you feel it."

He performs a test which p=
roves harmless to Maximal kind.  Rat Trap shakes his head no as well as Qui=
ckstride.

"Good, you can't feel the effects.  I do believe this frequency =
may just be able to do something mild to a Predacon and a Decepticon.  I do=
n't need to amp it by much, just enough to stun them, and hopefully get som=
e stasis cuffs on them before they move.  I have several pairs left on hand=
, just enough to capture a few more minions. Good thing this has its own ba=
ttery."

Quickstride prepares several of his energy weapons for use.

"Look=
s like we're tak'n a little detour."

Something in Tucson's directory snaps=
.  He raises a brow in alarm.  Thoughts race through his mind and one sudde=
nly hits him.

"Wait a minute..  Lord Elder, the attack on the base....  Wh=
y would they want an old base when there's more to be had at the Ark?  Of c=
ourse...  A DIVERSION!  THEY'RE PLANNING A DIVERSION SO THEY CAN GET US AWA=
Y FROM THE ARK!" 

He looks to Lord Elder in alarm.

"Sorry for raising my =
voice, that wasn't my intent, but the Ark is in grave danger and even with =
the shields, once the power is drained the shields will not function any mo=
re.  They know that Lord Elder.  They know that with an attack at the old M=
aximal Base, they can draw attention off the Ark and toward the base.  It l=
eaves it completely vulnerable to attack."

Rat Trap and Quickstride look t=
o each other and then back to Lord Elder and Tucson.

"So, what do we do Wh=
eels?"

Tucson sighs.

"There's four of us here.  Two of us go back to the =
Ark, and two of us continue to the Maximal base.  Of course, with Lord Elde=
rs permission.  It's the only way we can secure both locations at one time.=
"
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:=

>
> > " I - promise Lord Elder. Not one thing - will be touched in the ark=
. In honor of those I serve, I will - not upset any balance that still rema=
ins in place."
> 
> "That is good Tuscon." Lord Elder said as he struggled =
to keep the
> shuttle in flight. It was getting a little easier as he got u=
sed to
> the imbalance of one of the engines.
> 
> > "Actually, there is a =
name that fits ya better. What'dya think about TUCSON PRIME?"
> >
> > Quick=
stride gives Rat Trap a thumbs up.
> >
> > " Works for me, what'dya think L=
ord Elder?"
> 
> Lord Elder is silent for a moment, "The Primes are a speci=
al breed."
> he said finally, the look on his face grave. "They are chosen =
by the
> matrix, the name shouldn't be just given."
> 
> > " I sure know th=
at one Wheels. Primus knows we've all been there in some point in our lives=
. But I got a feeln' that I don't normally get.. I ain't usually too optimi=
stic but there's a tiny little feeling of optimism startn' ta build in me. =
Don't usually get this warm'n fuzzy but it's there. And it started when I f=
irst saw ya in that fortress. I think you got lucky for a reason Wheels, yo=
u got lucky because it was fate. Yep that's what it was, fate. And from wha=
t I kinda know about Roddimus... "Grime"... He wasn't too ready ta take on =
the responsibility of ben' a Prime officer, it just somehow happened. But y=
ou, on the other hand, you got what it takes. I think you might just be a l=
ost Prime, if ya ask me."
> 
> > "Hmph, let's see what Lord Elder thinks. S=
ir, what'dya think? Could Wheels be the next Autobot leader?"
> 
> Lord Eld=
er frowned as they spoke of Rodimus in derogatory terms,
> listening to the=
 name they called him. "A leader, a Prime is special.
> He must prove himse=
lf, not only in battle but also in wisdom, and be
> able to rally the Maxim=
als and Autobots." Elder glanced pointedly at
> Tuscon, "and he must learn =
to see past what he thinks is the obvious
> answer."
> 
> Elder turned back=
 to his controls as he linked up with the ark's
> systems, "No!" he said as=
 he watched one of his smaller screens in
> front him, "There is a Minion h=
overing over the old Maximal base"
> Elder glanced at Rat Trap, "The one yo=
u used when you first arrived."
> 
> Elder replayed the last set of transmi=
ssions:
> 
> > "Marauder." Legacy began, his voice carrying the
> > slighte=
st hint of curiousness. "We are holding no
> > minion prisoner. Whom do you=
 mean?"
> >
> > Marauder's voice quickly replied over the same
> > channel,=
 his voice calm and confident, "The minion
> > known as Lamia, she has call=
ed out to me, you will
> > release her immediately"
> 
> He looked back to =
his controls, "We may need to change course to assist."

ston
